header: Cri.Bail Application no. 171/19 CNR No. MHPU01-000655-2019

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 499/18 registered at MIDC Bhosari Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354,354D of the Indian Penal Code and under section 7,8 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012.

legalAct.actName: The Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act
legalAct.actShortNameList: POSCO,Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act

arguments.text: It is alleged that victim aged about 16 years lodged report stating that she was acquainted with applicant and he was driving rickshaw in the area of her residence. He was following her. On 02.12.2018 applicant came from back when victim was returning to house, applicant told her that he likes her and threatened to kill her if she talked with other children. Her uncle and mother convinced applicant. On 24.12.2018 at 5.30 p.m. when victim was going to house accused forced victim to sit in his rickshaw, she refused for it. She started going to house and accused followed her from his rickshaw, beat her, showed her knife and threatened to kill her if she refused to marry with him.

argumentSentences.text: It is alleged that victim aged about 16 years lodged report stating that she was acquainted with applicant and he was driving rickshaw in the area of her residence.
He was following her.
On 02.12.2018 applicant came from back when victim was returning to house, applicant told her that he likes her and threatened to kill her if she talked with other children.
Her uncle and mother convinced applicant.
On 24.12.2018 at 5.30 p.m. when victim was going to house accused forced victim to sit in his rickshaw, she refused for it.
She started going to house and accused followed her from his rickshaw, beat her, showed her knife and threatened to kill her if she refused to marry with him.

arguments.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. There is delay in lodging report. There is love affair between victim and applicant. Her parents opposed relationship and pressurized victim to lodge false report. Investigation is practically over. Applicant is 19 years old and pursuing his career. He is permanently residing at Bhosari, Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter.
There is delay in lodging report.
There is love affair between victim and applicant.
Her parents opposed relationship and pressurized victim to lodge false report.
Investigation is practically over.
Applicant is 19 years old and pursuing his career.
He is permanently residing at Bhosari, Pune.
He has no criminal antecedents.
He is ready to abide the conditions.
Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

arguments.text: 4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. There is possibility of his absconding as he is temporarily residing on the above address. So, they prayed to reject the application.

argumentSentences.text: 4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress.
Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses.
There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence.
There is possibility of his absconding as he is temporarily residing on the above address.
So, they prayed to reject the application.

arguments.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is sufficiently interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is 19 years old and pursuing his career. Applicant is resident of Bhosari, Pune. Applicant has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

argumentSentences.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious.
Applicant is sufficiently interrogated.
Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over.
Personal custody of applicant is not required.
Applicant is 19 years old and pursuing his career.
Applicant is resident of Bhosari, Pune.
Applicant has no criminal antecedents.
No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period.
Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

order.text: ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Akshay Prabhakar Doifode be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.25,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend MIDC, Bhosari Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not meet the victim and threat and pressurize the victim, shall not repeat the offence and shall not enter into vicinity of residence of victim. 6] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 7] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number.

footer: Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date – 16.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. processedText:
Cri.Bail Application no. 171/19 CNR No. MHPU01-000655-2019 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 499/18 registered at MIDC Bhosari Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354,354D of the Indian Penal Code and under section 7,8 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012. 
---background-ends---
It is alleged that victim aged about 16 years lodged report stating that she was acquainted with applicant and he was driving rickshaw in the area of her residence. He was following her. On 02.12.2018 applicant came from back when victim was returning to house, applicant told her that he likes her and threatened to kill her if she talked with other children. Her uncle and mother convinced applicant. On 24.12.2018 at 5.30 p.m. when victim was going to house accused forced victim to sit in his rickshaw, she refused for it. She started going to house and accused followed her from his rickshaw, beat her, showed her knife and threatened to kill her if she refused to marry with him. 
---argument-ends---
3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. There is delay in lodging report. There is love affair between victim and applicant. Her parents opposed relationship and pressurized victim to lodge false report. Investigation is practically over. Applicant is 19 years old and pursuing his career. He is permanently residing at Bhosari, Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. There is possibility of his absconding as he is temporarily residing on the above address. So, they prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is sufficiently interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is 19 years old and pursuing his career. Applicant is resident of Bhosari, Pune. Applicant has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­ 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Akshay Prabhakar Doifode be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.25,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend MIDC, Bhosari Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not meet the victim and threat and pressurize the victim, shall not repeat the offence and shall not enter into vicinity of residence of victim. 6] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 7] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number. 
---order-ends---
Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date – 16.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. Name of Steno ­ S.V.Thakar, Court Name ­ Smt.
